Sentencas: A small cogeneration system based on a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell (SOFC) fed on the renewable energy source biogas is presented.
Titulo: Energy balance model of a SOFC cogenerator operated with biogas

Sentencas: An existing farm biogas production site (35 m(3) per day), currently equipped with a SOFC demonstration stack, is taken for reference.
Titulo: Energy balance model of a SOFC cogenerator operated with biogas

Sentencas: A process flow diagram was defined in a software package allowing to vary system operating parameters like the fuel inlet composition, reforming technology, stack temperature and stack current (or fuel conversion).
Titulo: Energy balance model of a SOFC cogenerator operated with biogas

Sentencas: For system reforming simplicity, a base case parameter set was defined as the fuel inlet of 60% CH4:40% CO2 mixed with air in a 1:1 ratio, together with 800 degreesC operating temperature and 80% fuel conversion.
Titulo: Energy balance model of a SOFC cogenerator operated with biogas

Sentencas: A model stack, consisting of 100 series elements of anode supported electrolyte cells of 100 cm(2) each, was calculated to deliver 3.1 kW(el) and 5.16 kW(th) from an input of 1.5 N m(3)/h of biogas (8.95 kW LHV), corresponding to 33.8 and 57.6% electrical and thermal efficiencies (Lower Heating Values (LHVs)), respectively.
Titulo: Energy balance model of a SOFC cogenerator operated with biogas

Sentencas: The incidence on the efficiencies of the model system was examined by the variation of a number of parameters such as the CO2 content in the biogas, the amount of air addition to the biogas stream, the addition of steam to the fuel inlet, the air excess ratio lambda and the stack operating temperature, and the results discussed.
Titulo: Energy balance model of a SOFC cogenerator operated with biogas
Energy balance model of a SOFC cogenerator operated with biogas
Energy balance model of a SOFC cogenerator operated with biogas
